author: PerryThePlatypus
title: You'll love this figure!
review:
A perfect minifigure , for the perfect price!

I'm honestly kind of still surprised with the inclusion of an entire bike piece in a collectable minifigure packet , I'm very glad that Lego didn't omit the bike. If they did , this figure wouldn't be as good as it is.

Luckily, the bike isn't the only good thing about this figure. The main thing you are paying for IS the minifigure, and I'm glad to declare that the figure is also fantastic. I really appreciate the side leg detailing of the figure , things like the white stripes and the continuation of the knee pads are pretty cool. I also like the bandage printing on the arm , it's some great detailing. The 2 face prints are also nice. My personal preference is the determined expression with the glasses , which I absolutely love, the other expression is also good , but not as good as the expression with the glasses in my opinion. The new hair/helmet mold , while not the most useful mold out there , it's still a very welcome new piece.

This is definitely one of the more underrated minifigure of series 19. This figure doesn't beat the Dog Walker of the same series in my opinion, but this is one of the best figures of this series , as well as best values (with the bike pieces). This figure absolutely gets my recommendation , for the good value of the figure and the overall appearance.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: My only non motorcycle Lego bike
review:
Opening;

Mountain biker is a fabulous minifigure who happens to come with the joint biggest CMF piece along with beach batmans dolphin in the Batman movie series two .

The Minifigure-

Her helmet hair combo is very nice with dual moulded detail , she has a double sided face print with glasses and a smile , her torso is printed on the coral colour and she has dual moulded arms with one of them have an injury , her legs are also dual moulded and she has subsequent side leg printing .

The accessory -

Her accessory is a very nice bike which is a recolour of the one from the lego city outdoor adventures now in blue , it has two wheels in a dark yellow and two plain tyres . Her stand is just the plain old CMF stand .

In conclusion-

this is a good figure with a great accessory and I would recommend it to any Lego fan .

author: Odeinoichus
title: Riding the Mountains!
review:
Set #71025 Mountain Biker: We end Series 19 with highly ambitious character. The first CMF to include a large bike sculpt part as an accessory, we've had some skateboarders and surfing Minifigures with those accessories, but this is the first time we've seen an entire bike frame included with a CMF.

This particular bike frame is brand new in blue. The minifigure rides on it fairly nicely, leaning forward. Despite what the picture shows she can't slide all the way down, her legs are hindered by two bars on the side of the chassis. She uses a long flowing brunette hair and helmet combo and features some very nice printing with dual-moulded legs. Her top is very sporty and her arm is sporting a bandaid where she recently suffered a minor scrape.

One side has goggles and the other features a confident sassy smirking expression daring you to challenge her on her turf. Overall a strong offering from Series 19 and one I would highly recommend. Highly Recommended.
